nodes.bodyText: VertxMockSupport.anyHandler() can be used instead of any(Handler.class) to prevent the "unchecked assignment" warning.
It looks to me as if invoking autoProvisioner.setTracer() and autoProvisioner.setTenantInformationService() is missing here.
Have you tried defining AutoProvisioner as a Bean here instead, to make use of the Autowired annotations in the AutoProvisioner class?

Good catch, thanks! 😄
It turned out that the Tracer bean has to be taken from the root application context of the file based device registry and the TenantInformationService wasn't defined in the context so far leading to the NOOP service being used.
I could define AutoProvisioner as a bean instead, but then it must be refactored not to take any constructors arguments and use setters instead.
But as it seems @sophokles73 changed the declaration explicitly to use setters in 17179ad I am wondering if we should do this in the scope of this PR or re-discuss this in a separate issue and change the "bean-declaration-style" not just for the beans affected in this PR but for all beans (and for all other registries as well)...
Ok, yes, we can discuss a possible refactoring here once all registry changes have been merged.
